results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Eduardo Medina
results.title: 6-Year-Old Shoots Teacher at Virginia Elementary School, Police Say
results.abstract: A teacher at Richneck Elementary School in Newport News has “life-threatening injuries” after being shot by one of her students, the authorities said.

media.caption: A shooting in a classroom at Richneck Elementary School in Newport News, Va., happened on Friday after an altercation between a student and a teacher, officials said.

results.byline: By Ken Belson, Alan Blinder and Robin Stein
results.title: ‘We’re Going to Need Everybody’: Recordings Captured Response to N.F.L. Crisis
results.abstract: When Damar Hamlin’s heart stopped during a game on Monday night, medical personnel can be heard responding to the kind of emergency the league hoped it would never face.

media.caption: For about a half-hour at Paycor Stadium in Cincinnati, a small army of doctors, athletic trainers and emergency workers rushed to save Damar Hamlin.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Travel and Vacations;Content Type: Service;Customer Relations;Cruises;Insurance;American Airlines
results.title: Help! A Check-in Agent’s Mistake Made Me Miss an Antarctic Cruise and I’m Out $17,000.
results.abstract: An American Airlines error kept a traveler from getting to her cruise’s departure, but the carrier wouldn’t take financial responsibility and her trip insurance refused to pay. Then our columnist stepped in.

results.title: A Breach at LastPass Has Password Lessons for Us All
results.abstract: The hacking of the password manager should make us reassess whether to trust companies to store our sensitive data in the cloud.

results.byline: By Emmanuel Morgan and Dan Higgins
results.title: Damar Hamlin Has Breathing Tube Removed and Is Talking
results.abstract: The Buffalo Bills said Hamlin “continues to progress remarkably” and his neurological function was intact.

media.caption: Both Bills quarterback Josh Allen, left, and Coach Sean McDermott said the message they received from Damar Hamlin’s father, Mario, was the lift they needed to focus on the upcoming N.F.L. schedule.
media.copyright: Brendan Bannon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Alzheimer's Disease;Clinical Trials;Medicare;Placebos;Labeling and Labels (Product);Aduhelm (Drug);your-feed-healthcare;Biogen Inc;Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services;Eisai Co Ltd;Food and Drug Administration;New England Journal of Medicine;United States
results.title: F.D.A. Approves New Treatment for Early Alzheimer’s
results.abstract: The drug, Leqembi, may modestly slow cognitive decline in early stages of the disease but carries some safety risks. Still, data suggests it is more promising than the small number of other available treatments.
org_facet: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

media.caption: The newly approved drug, Leqembi, should be used only for patients in early and mild stages of Alzheimer’s disease, matching the status of patients in its clinical trials, the F.D.A. label says.

results.byline: By Michael Levenson, Livia Albeck-Ripka and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Utah Man Kills Wife, Five Children and Mother-in-Law, Police Say
results.abstract: Michael Haight, 42, fatally shot seven family members and then killed himself in the family’s house in Enoch City about two weeks after his wife filed for divorce, officials said.

media.caption: A law enforcement official stands near the front door of the Enoch, Utah, home where eight people had been fatally shot.
media.copyright: Ben B. Braun/The Deseret News, via Associated Press

results.title: Winning Numbers Drawn in Mega Millions Jackpot Worth Nearly $1 Billion
results.abstract: It was not yet clear Friday night if anyone had won the jackpot of nearly $1 billion. The winning numbers were: 3, 20, 46, 59, 63 and the gold Mega Ball 13.

media.caption: The largest lottery jackpot in U.S. history was for a winning Powerball ticket sold in November in Los Angeles. Joe Chahayed, the service station owner who sold it, collected a retailer bonus with his family.

results.title: Judge Rules for Justice Dept. in Dispute With Trump Over Documents Search

results.title: Trump Is Sued in Death of Capitol Police Officer After Jan. 6
results.abstract: The suit in the death of Brian D. Sicknick seeks millions in damages from the former president, whom it paints as responsible for the violence that day, and two Capitol rioters.
